text.0: god may a mortal call the strong hither with solemn rites to aid.
text.1: a man call agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.
text.2: near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory set to hold.
text.3: apart yon flamehued vault of heaven lovely beyond the thought of man.
text.4: yea this is by the light of him whom powerful song hath bound to act.
text.5: whose beams of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.
text.6: wealth loads the wonderworkers car through his the very wise ones power.
text.7: then meet to be invoked among all tribes is agni glorified.
text.8: now too the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips.
text.9: protect us for our welfare lend thy succour o thou son of strength be near in fight to prosper us.
